thread.title: American Family Insurance ALL-USA Boys Basketball Performances: Feb. 6-11
thread.title_full: American Family Insurance ALL-USA Boys Basketball Performances: Feb. 6-11

author: Richard Obert , azcentral sports
title: American Family Insurance ALL-USA Boys Basketball Performances: Feb. 6-11

organizations.name: american family insurance all-usa boys basketball

text:
Paradise Honors junior Jared Perry grew from 5'10 to 6'7 over the past three years at Paradise Honors High School on February 6, 2017 in Surprise, Ariz. (Photo: Patrick Breen/azcentral sports) 
107 CONNECT TWEET 1   A look at the top five high school boys basketball performers from the week of Feb. 6-11:
No. 1 Wesley Harris, Phoenix Desert Vista, F, 6-6, Jr. He had 21 points, making 8 of 11 shots, in an 86-74 win over Tempe Corona del Sol to close the regular season in 6A. He also had four rebounds.
RELATED: 2017 high school basketball playoffs schedule 
No. 2 Quincy Smith, Avondale La Joya, G, 6-2, Sr. He had 34 points, making 12 of 18 shots, in an 83-68 6A state tournament win on Friday. He also had six rebounds and four assists.
No. 3 Reed Richardson, Phoenix Arcadia, G, 6-0, Sr. In an 83-70 win over Scottsdale Chaparral, he had 27 points, making 10 of 13 field goals, 2 of 2 3-pointers and 5 of 6 free throws. He also had seven assists.
RELATED: Boys Basketball Player of the Year candidates 
No. 4 Tristan Yazzie, Tuba City, G, Jr. He had 28 points, making 10 of 19 shots and 4 of 10 3-pointers, in a 57-51 win over Kayenta Monument Valley. He followed that up with 14 points, making three 3-pointers, in a 67-57 win over Ganado for the 3A North regional title.
No. 5 Jared Perry, Surprise Paradise Honors, F, 6-7, Jr. He had 20 points, 17 rebounds and six blocked shots in a 68-62 win over Flagstaff Northland Prep that assured his team a spot in the final 16 in 2A as the No. 14 seed.
  azc_obert. 
Facebook Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Arizona's best high school boys basketball programs   Fullscreen Post to Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 
Take a look back at the schools that have won titles in boys basketball in Arizona since 1985, listed in order of championships.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 8 titles since 1985: Fort Thomas | School last won the 1A title under Terry Williams in 2005 when it finished 25-3 and beat Pima in the final, 63-45. Other titles since 1985 came in 2001, 2000, 1997, 1996, 1995, 1994 and 1989. 1995 team went 25-0.  Rob Schumacher/azcentral sports Fullscreen 7 titles since 1985: Mesa Mountain View | Gary Ernst's team won the 5A-I title in 2011 over Phoenix Brophy Prep, 50-29, to finish the season 27-3 overall. Other titles came in 2007, 2006 (5A-I), 2005, 1999, 1998 and 1995 (5A). 1995 team went 31-0. Team has only lost once in the title game, in 1992 to Phoenix South Mountain.  Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 6 titles since 1985: Tempe Corona del Sol | School won first title under Sam Duane Jr. in 2012 in Division I, defeating Cesar Chavez in the final. Team finished season 32-1. Team then repeated as champs in 2013 and made it three in a row in 2014 and four in a row in 2015. School also won the 1994 5A title and 1989 title under Sam Duane Sr.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 6 titles since 1985: Phoenix Scottsdale Christian | School won the 2010 2A title, going 28-1 on the season and defeating Phoenix Westwind Prep in the final, 52-47. School also won the Division III title in 2016. Others championships came in 2005, 2004, 2000 and 1999.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Gilbert Christian | School won the Division II title in 2015. Prior to that, it won back-to-back Division III titles in 2012-13. School went 32-0 and won 1A title in 2010, beating Phoenix Valley Lutheran 51-34 in the final. School also defeated Valley Lutheran in 2007 title game.  Crystal Ochoa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Chandler Valley Christian | Team won four titles in 2A in six years under coach Greg Haagsma, winning in 2003, 2004, 2006 and 2007. 2007 team went 34-1. School finished second in 2004, falling to Phoenix Scottsdale Christian in the final, 38-34. School also won the Division III title in 2014, beating Cortez in the title game, 64-53.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Phoenix North | School won back-to-back titles in 2009-10 under coach Joseph Bustos, the first coming in 5A-II and the second in 5A-I. Hector Bejarano led team to three 4A titles in 4 years with championships in 1988, 1990 and 1991. Team finished second in 1986 and 1987.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 5 titles since 1985: Thatcher | School most recently won 2A title in 1995 under coach Kenny Smith, defeating Superior in the final, 44-41. Paul Nelson led school to titles in 1991, 1990, 1986 and 1985. (School won six straight titles from 1981-86). Team has been the runner-up nine times since 1985.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: Phoenix Shadow Mountain | Under coach Jerry Connor, school won 5A titles in 2000 and 1996. 2000 team beat Gilbert Highland, 79-53. 1996 team defeated Tempe Corona del Sol, 81-56. School lost the 1995 final to undefeated Mesa Mountain View, 78-71. School also won the Division II in 2014 as the No. 8 seed, beating Flagstaff in the final, 83-58. It also won the Div. II title in 2016.  Aldei Gregoire/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: Phoenix South Mountain | David Grace's team defeated Glendale Deer Valley in the 5A-II title game in 2006, 75-54, to finish the season 30-4 overall. Clement Chapman led school to 5A titles in 1992 and 1991 with 1991 squad going a perfect 32-0. Charles Dean led school to title in 1987.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: Phoenix Carl Hayden | School last won 5A title in 1997 when it went 26-3 under coach Argie Rhymes and defeated Tucson Salpointe in overtime, 80-75. 1993 team went 29-1 on its way to the title. School's other two titles came in 1987 and 1986 in 4A tournaments.  Carlos Chavez/azcentral sports Fullscreen 4 titles since 1985: Coolidge | Dave Glasgow's teams won 3A titles in 2002, 1999 and 1998. 2002 squad went 32-0 on the season. James Boyd coached team to 3A title in 1992. That team finished 27-1 and beat Kayenta Monument Valley, 58-53, in the final.  Mona Reeder/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Mesa | Shawn Lynch's team won the 2004 5A title over Phoenix Desert Vista, 54-46, to finish the season 28-3. Paul Newendyke coached team to 5A title in 1988 with a 78-76 win over Tucson Sahuaro in the state title game. Team also won the Div. I title in 2016.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Phoenix Arizona Lutheran | Doug Meyer's team won the 1A title in 1999 despite going just 22-12 on the season. Team beat The Orme School in the final, 49-44. In 2014 as the No. 2 seed, school beat No. l seeded Scottsdale Prep in the Division IV title game, 73-65. Team repeated as champions in 2015 with a 49-47 win over Scottsdale Prep.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Phoenix Paradise Valley | Bill Farrell's teams won two titles in three seasons in 4A, taking the 1995 and 1997 championships. 1997 team finished 29-2 while 1995 team went 29-4. 1995 team edged Cottonwood Mingus in the final, 54-52. School won the Division II title in 2013 under coach Mark MacGowan.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Scottsdale Saguaro | Under coach Mike Cady, team won 5A title in 1990 over Tempe Corona del Sol, 88-78, to finish 22-8. Cady also led school to the 4A title in 1996 and finished 26-4 overall. In 2004, Bob LaRue's squad went 26-5 on its way to 4A title.  Carlos Chavez/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Glendale Apollo | School won three straight titles under Mark Nold in 2007, 2006 (4A-I) and 2005 (4A). 2007 team defeated Oro Valley Ironwood Ridge in the final and finished the season 26-6.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Goodyear Estrella Foothills | Ty Amundsen's teams won three straight 3A titles from 2008-10, defeating Payson, Chinle and Eagar Round Valley in the finals, respectively. 2010 team finished season 31-1.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Fountain Hills | School won three straight 3A titles from 2005-2007. 2005 and 2006 titles came under coach Cain Jagodzinski, while Steve Tooker led school to 2007 title. 2005 team went 32-1 on the season.  Suzanne Starr/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Kayenta Monument Valley | School won 3A title in 1997 over Lakeside Blue Ridge, 63-49, and went 29-2 overall. Also won title in 1996 over Ganado, 57-54. Other title came in 1993.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Safford | In 1994, school went 21-4 under coach Joe Burnside on way to 3A title. Team beat Fort Defiance Window Rock, 66-52, in the final. School also won 1986 and 1985 3A titles under Burnside, going 23-0 in both seasons.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 3 titles since 1985: Buckeye | Marlin Diller's team went 24-1 in 1990, winning the 3A state final over Snowflake, 70-66. Randy Spilsbury coached team to back-to-back titles in 1987-88 with 1988 team going a perfect 27-0.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Snowflake | School won the Div. III title in 2015 with a 57-52 win over San Tan Valley Combs in the title game. Also won the title in 1989 in 3A. That team went 21-7 and defeated Holbrook in the final 76-63. School finished second in 1990.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Phoenix St. Mary's | Won the 5A-I title in 2009 over Gilbert Highland, 70-62, under coach David Lopez to finish season 22-4. Other title came in 2001 in 5A with a 64-57 win over Phoenix Brophy Prep. School finished second in 2008, 2007 and 2005.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Gilbert | Tom Bennett's team won the 5A title in 2003 over Phoenix Desert Vista, 56-51 and finished season 31-3. Gary Morton led team to 18-5 record and the 4A title in 1985 with a 52-51 overtime win over Glendale in the final.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tempe McClintock | First state title came in 1986 under coach Doc Zinke with a 71-67 win over previously unbeaten Phoenix Brophy Prep in the 5A title game. Jase Coburn's team won the school's second title in 2010 with a 73-71 win over Phoenix Sunnyslope in the 4A-I final.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Phoenix Sunnyslope | School won the 2009 4A-I title under coach Dan Mannix with a 78-65 win over Avondale Agua Fria. 2002 team won 4A title with 61-55 win over Page. That team finished 29-1. School lost to Tucson Sahuaro in 2001 title game.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Santa Rita | Jim Ferguson's team broke through to win the 2010 4A-II title over Tucson Amphitheater, 86-84, after losing in four of the previous five title games. School's other title came in 4A in 1999 with a 50-41 overtime win over Phoenix Thunderbird.  Paul F. Gero/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Sahuaro | Dick McConnell's teams won 4A titles in back-to-back years in 2000-01, going 24-7 and 26-7 respectively. Team defeated Tucson Palo Verde in 2000, 72-58, and beat Phoenix Sunnyslope, 62-55, in 2001.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tuba City | Charles Grover's team won back-to-back 3A titles in 2000-01. 2001 team beat Coolidge in the final, 69-57. 2000 team edged Winslow, 65-62. 2000 team finished 28-4 while 2001 squad went 23-7.  Rob Schumacher/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Phoenix Northwest Christian | Bill Harbeck's team won the 2A title in 2008 with a 56-42 win over Thatcher in the state final. Team finished with 28-5 record. Tim Keith guided team to 26-3 record and 2A championship in 1993 in 1A.  Catherine J. Jun/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Superior | James Acton's team went 27-0 in 1998 and won the 2A title over Phoenix Christian, 55-50. School beat Phoenix Christian in 1996 title game, 54-43, for other title. Finished second in 1995.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Phoenix Christian | Don Thorp's squads went 23-2 in 1988 and 25-1 in 1989 and won 2A titles over Thatcher both seasons. School finished as the runner-up in 1998 and 1996.  Tom Tingle/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson St. Gregory | Won back-to-back titles under coach Paul Baranowski in 1A in 2008-09. 2008 team went 32-3 and 2009 team went 35-1. 1998 team lost to St. David in the state final.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Seligman | Brian Matzenbacker coached team to 1A title in 2006 as school defeated The Orme School in the final, 66-57, to finish with a 23-6 record. School also won 1986 title under Charles Lee.  Yoko Furukawa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: St. David | John Bryant's team went 27-0 in 2002 and beat St. Michael in the 1A final, 68-45. School also won the 1998 1A title over Tucson St. Gregory.  Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 2 titles since 1985: Tucson Green Fields | School won 1991 title in 1A under coach Brian Peabody with a 61-56 win over Seligman. Bill Ludeke coached team to 1990 title; a 65-47 win over Fort Thomas. School was the runner-up in 1992 and 1989.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Yumna Catholic | School took home the Div. IV title in 2016 for its first state championship. It went 31-1 on the season and defeated Phoenix Country Day for the title 77-61.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: San Carlos: Team won the Div. V title in 2016. It beat Bisbee in the title game in overtime, 57-53. The school went 28-4 on the season.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Glendale Joy Christian | School won the state title in 2013 in Division IV under coach Scott Brown. School defeated Arizona Lutheran, 74-63, for the title.  Leslie Brown Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Peoria | School won the Division II title in 2012 with a 50-48 win over Tucson Amphitheater in the state championship game. That team finished the season with a record of 27-3.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Country Day | School won the 2012 Division IV title over Arizona Lutheran 49-29 to win its first state championship.  Richard Obert/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Elfrida Valley Union | Under coach L.W. Jackson, school won the 1A title in 1985 over Salome, 58-48. Team finished with a 20-3 record that season.  Yoko Furukawa/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Desert Vista | School's lone state title came in 5A-I in 2008 under coach Doug Harris. That team defeated Phoenix St. Mary's, 63-50, in the final to finish the year 26-5 overall. Team finished second in both 2003 and 2004.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Laveen Betty Fairfax | Don Dominguez's team won first state title in 2011 with a 65-60 win in two overtimes over Scottsdale Chaparral in 5A-II final. That team finished 23-7 overall.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Anthem Boulder Creek | Under coach Randy Walker, school won only state title in 5A-II in 2010 with a 59-58 win over Scottsdale Chaparral. That team ended the season 28-2 overall.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Oro Valley Ironwood Ridge | Only state championship came in 2008 in 5A-II under coach Brian Peabody. That team defeated Tempe Marcos de Niza, 61-51, in the title game and finished the year 27-6.  Pat Shannahan/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Scottsdale Desert Mountain | School won 5A-II championship in 2007 over Phoenix Paradise Valley, 65-55. Todd Fazio coached team to 21-11 record that season.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tempe Marcos de Niza | In 2002, school won the 5A title under coach David Stark with a 60-49 win over Gilbert Highland. That team went 25-8 on the season. School made the 5A-II title game in 2008 despite finishing the season 15-17 overall. It lost to Oro Valley Ironwood Ridge in the final, 61-51.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Alhambra | School won the 5A title in 1985 under coach Phil Kemp to finish the season 27-1. Team beat Tucson Catalina, 77-58, in the final. School also won the 1974 title under Kemp.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Nogales | Ricardo De La Riva's team won the 2011 4A-I title over Scottsdale Saguaro, 57-44, to finish the season 25-5 overall. School won 4 titles prior to 1985.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Goodyear Millennium | Mike Lopez's team won the 4A-I title in 2008 in its lone appearance in a title game. That team defeated Avondale Agua Fria in overtime in the final, 49-48, and finished 23-6 overall.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Amphitheater | In 2011, school won the 4A-II title with an 87-77 win over Tempe to finish the year with a record of 29-2. School lost to Tucson Santa Rita in the 2010 final, 86-84.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Greenway | Howard Mueller's team won the 4A-II title in 2009 over Tucson Santa Rita, 60-58, capping a perfect 30-0 season. Team finished second in the 1998 and 1997 4A state tournaments.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Goodyear Desert Edge | Team went 28-2 in 2008 in 4A-II on way to the title under coach Joe Babinski. School beat Tucson Santa Rita in the final, 40-36.  Catherine J. Jun/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Bullhead City Mohave | Pat Woodburn coached team to 2006 4A-II title. That team defeated Page 50-46 in the title game and finished the year with a record of 26-7 overall.  Deirdre Hamill/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Scottsdale Notre Dame Prep | Only title came in 2007 in 4A-II under coach Matt Harris. That team finished the year with a record of 27-5 and defeated Tucson Santa Rita in the final, 61-56.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Thunderbird | In 2003, Buddy Rake's team defeated Scottsdale Saguaro in the 4A final, 60-54. Team went 28-5 that season. School lost to Tucson Santa Rita in the 1999 4A final in overtime, 50-41.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Moon Valley | School went 27-3 in 1998 on its way to the 4A title, defeating Phoenix Greenway in the title game, 54-52. John Boie was the coach.  Tom Tingle/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Glendale Cactus | In 1994, team went 23-7 on its way to its only state title, a 62-60 win over Phoenix Paradise Valley in the 4A final under coach Kenny Troutt. School finished second in 1991.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Sunnyside | Team went 29-0 on way to 4A title in 1993 under coach Dwight Rees. The school beat Tucson Sabino in overtime, 60-53.  Xavier Gallegos/Tucson Citizen Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Cholla | Paul Dull's team won the 4A title in 1992 with an 88-84 win over Tucson Santa Rita in the championship game. The team finished with a 26-6 record that season.  Francisco Medina/Tucson Citizen Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Casa Grande | Bruce Kieser coached school to 4A title in 1989. That team defeated Flagstaff Coconino in the title game, 71-63, and finished the season 24-5.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Holbrook | Lone title came under coach Raul Mendoza in 2011 in 3A final with 49-43 win over Fountain Hills. School finished second in 1989 and 1991.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Rio Rico | John Fanning's team defeated Chandler Seton Catholic in the 3A final in 2004, 63-56. Team finished 27-8 on the season.  Dave Cruz/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Globe | School went 33-0 in 2003 on way to the 3A title under coach Tony Lopez. It beat Kayenta Monument Valley, 68-51, in the final.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Fort Defiance Window Rock | Only state title came in 3A in 1995 when team defeated Winslow in the final, 68-48. That team, coached by Bo Whitelock, finished 23-6. School lost to Safford in 1994 title game.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Eagar Round Valley | The school won the 1991 3A title under coach Mike Smith with a 59-56 win over Holbrook in the final. That team finished 24-6. School lost to Goodyear Estrella Foothills in 2010 final.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Westwind Prep | Gary Trousdale's team won the 2A title in 2011, beating Thatcher in the final, 82-63. Team finished 29-2 on the season. School was the runner-up in 2010, falling to Phoenix Scottsdale Christian, 52-47.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Phoenix Precision | School defeated Thatcher 75-72 in overtime to win the 2A title in 2009 under coach Killy Mims. Team finished with a 28-6 record that year.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Tucson Desert Christian | Chris Walter coached team to 2A title in 2001. That squad defeated Thatcher in the final, 39-35, and finished 27-7 on the season. Team finished second in 2007.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Keams Canyon Hopi | School won the 2A title in 1997 under coach Rick Baker, defeating Willcox in the state final, 68-62. Team finished 27-5 that season. School lost the 1999 final to Phoenix Scottsdale Christian in overtime, 58-53.  Catherine J. Jun/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Bisbee | Vince Creviston's team won the 2A title in 1994 and finished 24-4 on the season. It beat Thatcher in the final, 73-62.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Whiteriver Alchesay | Only state title came in 2A in 1993 under coach Reedy David with a 52-51 win over Camp Verde in the championship game. School finished as the runner-up in 3A in 1998, falling to Coolidge, 56-53.  Peter Schwepker/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Kearny Ray | Bill Goodwin's squad took home the 2A championship in 1992 with a 72-70 win over Wickenburg. That team finished with a 23-2 record.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Ajo | Team won 2A title under Bo Whitelock in 1987 and finished 21-2 overall. It beat Thatcher in the final, 52-43. School lost to Thatcher in 1986 2A title game.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: The Orme School | Lone 1A title came in 2011 under coach Todd Roe when team went a perfect 25-0 and defeated Gilbert Christian in the final, 68-56. School lost the 2006, 1999 and 1995 title games.  David Wallace/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Duncan | Lone title since 1985 came under coach Andrew Larson in 2004 in 1A with 49-44 win over Joseph City in the state final. That team finished the season 28-4 overall. School lost the 2008 1A final to Tucson St. Gregory.  Mike Rynearson/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Joseph City | School won the 2003 1A title under coach Bryan Fields with a 57-41 win over Fredonia. Team finished with a record of 32-2 that season. School lost to Duncan in 2004 final, 49-44.  Cheryl Evans/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Clifton | Only state championship came in 1992 under coach Steve Hudgens. That team defeated Tucson Green Fields in the 1A final, 65-54, and ended the year 24-4. School lost in the title game in 1993.  Michael Schennum/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Salome | Only title since 1985 came in 1988 when team went 20-4 under coach Byron Maynes and defeated Phoenix Scottsdale Christian in the state championship, 46-38.  Michael Chow/azcentral sports Fullscreen 1 title since 1985: Fredonia | School won the state title in 1987 under coach George McCormick. Team beat Phoenix Arizona Lutheran in title game, 69-55, and finished season 19-4.  David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports Fullscreen Like this topic?
